answers.answer: High risk pregnancies are categorized by a number of things. For example, I have a pre-existing kidney disease, so that made me high risk from the get-go, and then yesterday I found out that I have preeclampsia, so now I'm extremely high risk. You usually have to see your OB more, get more ultrasounds, and be watched more carefully than normal patients.

question: Last night, the doctor in the hospital told me that because of pre-term labor, slow fetal growth, severe dehydration, and my failing gallbladder, I am now a high risk pregnancy at 18+4. what exactly does that mean? What do I need to do different? What questions should I ask my doctor when I finally get to see him on Monday?
title: What is a Hugh risk pregnancy?
